h3.a: Coronavirus COVID-19 Updates--Lo-Ma Schools are Closed the Remainder of School Year. Kid Care is also closed.

div.p:
April 17, 2020
Governor Kim Reynolds announced today that schools in the state of Iowa will be closed for the reminder of the year. She also announced that all spring activities are canceled. Even though it is unfortunate that school will be closed, it is also understandable.
During the next few weeks our administrative team will be meeting daily to determine what is the best path for our students. I know there are . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus COVID-19 Updates--Lo-Ma Schools are Closed the Remainder of School Year. Kid Care is also closed.

div.p: There's no doubt this school year has been (and continues to be) one for the history books! From outstanding musical performances to repeat championships and academic excellence, even to this historic pandemic, through it all our #PantherPride has not faltered. Help keep those memories from fading away by purchasing a 2019-2020 annual from the Lo-Ma yearbook staff. Simply fill out this form to reserve your yearbook . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Reserve Your Yearbook Today!

div.p:
Preschool registration will be online this year for any 3 or 4 year old students interested in attending Lo-Ma preschool for the 2020-2021 school year. Registration forms may be found on the lomaschools.org website. Please fill out the registration form and email to schase@lomaschools.org or mail to the Logan-Magnolia Elementary School, Attn: Sharon Chase, 1200 N. 2 nd Avenue, Logan, Iowa 51546.
. . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Logan-Magnolia Preschool Registration

div.p:
Dear Parents,
We are finishing up week 2 of the coronavirus shutdown. My prayer is that all is well with you and your family during these trying times. This crisis will end and my hope is that we will all be stronger when it does. Below are a few updates and reminders as we deal our new norm:
The principals, Mrs. Gochenour and Mrs. Kiger, will be reaching out to the parents of the students in their respective . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus Updates--March 26, 2020

h3.a: Unanticipated Closure Press Release Regarding Meals Served to Students During School Closure

div.p:
Unanticipated Closure Press Release- SFSP Meal Service
Logan-Magnolia Community School District to Serve Meals to Children During School Closure
The closure to the Logan-Magnolia Community School District due to the COVID-19 virus could be especially tough for families who receive free and reduced-price meals at school. It could mean hunger for many students. To help fight the hunger, the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Unanticipated Closure Press Release Regarding Meals Served to Students During School Closure

h3.a: Note from the Harrison County Director of Medicine

div.p:
Dear Harrison County Residents:
As a local physician, medical director and primary care provider I have been asked to share my thoughts on the pandemic coronavirus known as COVID-19:
-We have known COVID-19 in our county and known exposure to community members, the extent of which we cannot say, and our knowledge of how it is spread is changing daily.
-We have very few tests and very strict . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Note from the Harrison County Director of Medicine

h3.a: You're Invited to the Upcoming Spring Music Concerts!

div.p:
There are opportunities for the community to see Lo-Ma students perform this spring.
•The 5th and 6th grade musical will me Thursday, April 30, 2020 at 7 pm.
•The 5th and 6th grade band/5-8 Band and Vocal Concert will be Tuesday, May 5, 2020 at 7 pm.

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.p: The Logan-Magnolia Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study: Business, Health Science, Family Consumer Science, Industrial Technology, and Agricultural Science.

It is the policy of the Logan-Magnolia Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity, and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. lf you have questions related to this policy please contact Jacob Hedger, Equity Coordinator, 1200 North 200 Avenue, Logan, IA 51546, 712-644-2250, jhedger@lomaschools.org.
